briefdescription.para: returns the initial values of the state variables
returns the drift part of the equation, i.e., $ \mu(t, \mathrm{x}_t) $
returns the diffusion part of the equation, i.e. $ \sigma(t, \mathrm{x}_t) $

memberdef.argsstring: (Time t0, const Array &x0, Time dt) const override
memberdef.name: covariance

detaileddescription.para: returns the covariance $ V(\mathrm{x}_{t_0 + \Delta t} | \mathrm{x}_{t_0} = \mathrm{x}_0) $ of the process after a time interval $ \Delta t $ according to the given discretization. This method can be overridden in derived classes which want to hard-code a particular discretization.
applies a change to the asset value. By default, it returns $ \mathrm{x} + \Delta \mathrm{x} $.

memberdef.argsstring: (Time t0, const Array &x0, Time dt, const Array &dw) const override
memberdef.name: evolve

detaileddescription.para: returns the asset value after a time interval $ \Delta t $ according to the given discretization. By default, it returns \[E(\mathrm{x}_0,t_0,\Delta t) + S(\mathrm{x}_0,t_0,\Delta t) \cdot \Delta \mathrm{w} \] where $ E $ is the expectation and $ S $ the standard deviation.

briefdescription.para: returns the number of dimensions of the stochastic process
returns the number of independent factors of the process

detaileddescription.para: stochastic process of a libor forward model using the rolling forward measure incl. predictor-corrector step
Glasserman, Paul, 2004, Monte Carlo Methods in Financial Engineering, Springer, Section 3.7
Antoon Pelsser, 2000, Efficient Methods for Valuing Interest Rate Derivatives, Springer, 8
Hull, John, White, Alan, 1999, Forward Rate Volatilities, Swap Rate Volatilities and the Implementation of the Libor Market Model (http://www.rotman.utoronto.ca/~amackay/fin/libormktmodel2.pdf)

xrefdescription.para: the correctness is tested by Monte-Carlo reproduction of caplet & ratchet NPVs and comparison with Black pricing.

simplesect.para: this class does not work correctly with Visual C++ 6.
